msubsection.title: svnSetting
msubsection.p: Allows to configure the access to the subversion repository within a <svnSetting> elements.

attribute.name: dateFormatter
attribute.doc: formatter definition used to format/parse dates (e.g. when revision is specified as date).

attribute.name: dateTimeZone
attribute.doc: time zone used to format/parse dates (e.g. when revision is specified as date).

attribute.name: id
attribute.doc: The Id which is used to refer to these settings.

attribute.name: username
attribute.doc: username that will be used for all nested svn commands.

attribute.name: password
attribute.doc: password that will be used for all nested svn commands.

attribute.name: javahl
attribute.doc: Set to "false" to use command line client interface instead of JNI JavaHL binding.

attribute.name: svnkit
attribute.doc: Set to "false" to use command line client interface instead of SVNKit binding.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.doc: Controls whether an error stops the build or is merely reported to the screen.

attribute.name: sshkeypath
attribute.doc: Specifies the location of a SSH private key.

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !

attribute.name: sshpassphrase
attribute.doc: Specifies the passphrase for the SSH private key.

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !

attribute.name: sshport
attribute.doc: The port to be used when connecting using SSH. If the connection URL contains a port number this will be used instead.

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !

attribute.name: sslclientcertpath
attribute.doc: The path of a SSL client certificate.

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !

attribute.name: sslpassword
attribute.doc: The password for the SSL connection.

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !

attribute.name: certreject
attribute.doc: Boolean which allows to reject untrusted certificates in general. By default they are accepted temporarily (we don't want to break with previous implementations).

doc.b: UNTESTED FEATURE: NOT SUPPORTED BY THE COMMANDLINE CLIENT ! SUBJECT TO CHANGE !
